description.narrative: The Oxfam Knowledge Hub on Governance <(>&<)> Citizenship is one of five Knowledge Hubs set up by Oxfam to support strategic learning on key topics and to foster an active learning network among staff of Oxfam and partners on these topics. Why Knowledge Hubs and what do they help us to do?•Knowledge helps us adapt and stay relevant in a rapidly changing world. Being a knowledge-led organisation means harnessing our staff and our partners experience and expertise to have greater influence and impact in reducingpoverty and inequality.•Knowledge Hub’s help us to locate, articulate and use and our collective knowledge.•Knowledge Hub’s help to connect staff and partners to others who have relevant knowledge, and to navigate knowledge on a themeWe do this to support people to learn to adapt and to adapt programmes based on what they have learnt.The KHG<(>&<)>C mission is to “make knowledge be more visible, accessible and used to deliver greater impact <(>&<)> influence”One of the priority topics for the KHG<(>&<)>Cis that ofstrengthening civic space. We do this in line with Oxfam’s Civic Space Strategy which works towards the following key transformative changes to combat drivers of shrinking civic space: -More engaged and active citizenry with positive attitudes towards the role and value of civil society (CS) andcivic space -Increased resilience and effectiveness of civil society partners -Strengthening and making effective use of judicial, regulatory, and legal systems that impact civic space -More vocal champions and more prominence for civic space in discourses from regional and global institutions and actors

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

Oxfam is increasingly able to support informal movements and new ways of organizing of activists in an adaptive and flexible way.
cases where Oxfam and partners use of digital technology, safely, and facilitating spaces for online and offline mutual learning
cases where Oxfam give space for agenda's and paths/autonomy of partners and rights holders, for co-creation and leading
cases where Oxfam's theory of change is based on a thorough power, gender and stakeholder analysis
cases where more flexible procedures and rules allowed effectively working with partners and informal movements responding to contextual challenges and opportunities
